types.OperationDefinition: fields: operation_type str, name Optional[str], variable_definitions List[VariableDefinition], directives List[Directive], selection_set SelectionSet
types.Field: fields: name str, alias Optional[str], arguments List[Argument], directives List[Directive], selection_set Optional[SelectionSet]
types.FragmentDefinition: fields: name str, type_condition NamedType, directives List[Directive], selection_set SelectionSet
types.InlineFragment: fields: type_condition Optional[NamedType], directives List[Directive], selection_set SelectionSet
types.VariableDefinition: fields: variable Variable, type Type, default_value Optional[Value]
types.EnumValue: fields: value Any, description Optional[str], deprecation_reason Optional[str]
types.ScalarType: fields: (inherits from GraphQLType) serialize Callable, parse_value Callable, parse_literal Callable
types.ObjectType: fields: (inherits from GraphQLType) fields Dict[str, GraphQLField], interfaces List[InterfaceType]
types.GraphQLField: fields: type GraphQLType, args Dict[str, GraphQLArgument], resolve Optional[Callable], description Optional[str], deprecation_reason Optional[str]
types.GraphQLArgument: fields: type GraphQLType, default_value Any, description Optional[str]
types.InterfaceType: fields: (inherits from GraphQLType) fields Dict[str, GraphQLField], resolve_type Optional[Callable]
types.UnionType: fields: (inherits from GraphQLType) types List[ObjectType], resolve_type Optional[Callable]
types.EnumType: fields: (inherits from GraphQLType) values Dict[str, EnumValue]
types.InputObjectType: fields: (inherits from GraphQLType) fields Dict[str, GraphQLInputField]
types.GraphQLInputField: fields: type GraphQLType, default_value Any, description Optional[str]
types.Schema: fields: query_type ObjectType, mutation_type Optional[ObjectType], subscription_type Optional[ObjectType], types Dict[str, GraphQLType], directives Dict[str, GraphQLDirective], extensions Dict[str, Any], source_services List[Dict], directive_locations Dict[str, List[str]]
types.GraphQLDirective: fields: name str, locations List[str], args Dict[str, GraphQLArgument], description Optional[str], execution_hooks Optional[Dict[str, Callable]]
types.ExecutionContext: fields: schema Schema, document_ast Document, operation_name Optional[str], variable_values Dict[str, Any], context_value Any, root_value Any, fragments Dict[str, FragmentDefinition], errors List[GraphQLError], data_loaders Dict[str, DataLoader], path List[PathSegment], field_resolver Callable, type_resolver Callable, validation_rules List[ValidationRule], field_middleware List[FieldMiddleware], query_transformers List[QueryTransformer], error_formatters Dict[Type[Exception], ErrorFormatter]
types.GraphQLError: fields: message str, locations List[Location], path List[PathSegment], original_error Optional[Exception], extensions Dict[str, Any]
types.DataLoader: fields: batch_load_fn Callable, cache Dict, queue List, max_batch_size int
types.ExecutionResult: fields: data Optional[Dict], errors List[GraphQLError], extensions Dict[str, Any]
types.SQLQuery: fields: root_select SQLSelect, nested_selects List[SQLSelect], parameters List[SQLParameter], result_mapper Optional[Callable[[List[Dict]], Dict]], query_plan Dict[str, Any]
types.SQLSelect: fields: from_table SQLTable, joins List[SQLJoin], where Optional[SQLExpression], order_by List[SQLOrderBy], limit Optional[int], offset Optional[int], columns List[SQLColumn], distinct bool, group_by List[SQLColumn]
types.SQLTable: fields: name str, schema Optional[str], alias Optional[str]
types.SQLJoin: fields: type str, table SQLTable, on SQLExpression
types.SQLColumn: fields: table SQLTable, name str, alias Optional[str], expression Optional[str]
types.SQLExpression: fields: kind str, operator Optional[str], left Optional[SQLExpression], right Optional[SQLExpression], value Any, column Optional[SQLColumn]
types.SQLParameter: fields: name str, value Any, type str
types.Token: fields: type TokenType, value str, line int, column int
types.TokenType: enum: EOF, NAME, INT, FLOAT, STRING, BLOCK_STRING, PUNCTUATION, SPREAD
types.DatabaseMetadata: fields: tables Dict[str, TableMetadata], enums Dict[str, List[str]], version str
types.TableMetadata: fields: name str, schema str, comment Optional[str], columns List[ColumnMetadata], primary_key_columns List[str], foreign_keys List[Dict[str, Any]]
types.ColumnMetadata: fields: name str, table_name str, table_schema str, data_type str, is_nullable bool, is_primary_key bool, default_value Optional[str], character_maximum_length Optional[int], numeric_precision Optional[int], numeric_scale Optional[int], comment Optional[str]
types.Relationship: fields: source_table str, source_columns List[str], target_table str, target_columns List[str], relationship_type str, foreign_key_name Optional[str], is_self_referential bool
types.ReflectionOptions: fields: include_tables List[str], exclude_tables List[str], table_prefix str, table_suffix str, field_naming_convention NamingConvention, type_naming_convention NamingConvention, type_mappings Dict[str, Any], include_relationships bool, max_relationship_depth int, include_comments bool, readonly bool, include_aggregates bool, include_filters bool, include_pagination bool
types.BaseIntrospector: abstract class with methods: connect, introspect_tables, get_table_comment, get_column_comments, close
types.SQLBuilder: fields: dialect SQLDialect, _parameters List[SQLParameter], _sql_parts List[str], _param_counter int
types.JoinPlan: fields: left_table str, right_table str, join_type str, on_conditions List[Tuple[str, str]], relationship Relationship, alias Optional[str]
types.GraphQLEnginePlugin: fields: name str, version str, enabled bool
types.WebSocketTransport: fields: execution_context_factory Callable, connections Dict[str, Any]
types.CacheBackend: abstract class with methods: get, set, invalidate_pattern
types.TransportProtocol: abstract class with methods: handle_request, supports_subscriptions
types.DirectiveVisitor: abstract class with methods: visit_field_definition, visit_argument_definition
types.SQLDialect: abstract class with methods: get_type_mappings, supports_feature, generate_pagination_sql

methods.parse_query(query_str) returns Document: Parse GraphQL query string into AST
methods.Parser.parse_document() returns Document: Parse complete GraphQL document from tokens
methods.create_schema(query_type, mutation_type,: Create and validate a complete GraphQL schema
methods.validate_schema(schema) returns None: Validate a complete schema for consistency
methods.is_input_type(type) returns bool: Return True if the type can be used as an input type
methods.is_output_type(type) returns bool: Return True if the type can be used as an output type
methods.execute_query(schema, document_ast, vari: Execute GraphQL query against schema with full parameters
methods.reflect_schema(connection_config, option: Main entry point: reflect database schema to GraphQL schema
methods.get_database_metadata(connection_config,: Low-level method to get raw database metadata without building GraphQL types
methods.TypeMapper.map_column_type(column) retur: Map a database column to a GraphQL type with appropriate modifiers
methods.RelationshipAnalyzer.analyze(metadata) r: Analyze all foreign keys to build relationship graph
methods.compile_to_sql(schema, document_ast, ope: Main compilation entry point: converts a GraphQL query into executable SQL with parameters
methods.plan_joins(root_table, relationships, se: Plan optimal JOIN order for accessing all tables in selection paths
methods.should_propagate_null(value, field_type): Determine if null should propagate upward
methods.apply_null_propagation(result, error) re: Apply null propagation rules to result dictionary
methods.sanitize_database_error(error, sql) retu: Convert database exception to safe GraphQL error
methods.Parser.expect(token_type, value) returns: Expect specific token, record error if not found
methods.Executor.execute_field(parent_type, fiel: Execute single field with error handling
methods.ASTPrinter.print_document(doc, indent) r: Print AST in human-readable indented format
methods.ASTPrinter.print_field(field, indent) re: Print field with arguments and directives
methods.SQLExplainer.explain(sql_query, analyze): Run EXPLAIN on generated SQL queries
methods.DirectiveMiddleware.register_directive_h: Register a handler function for a specific directive
methods.DirectiveMiddleware.execute_field_with_d: Execute a field with directive middleware wrapping
methods.DirectiveMiddleware._create_directive_wr: Create a wrapper function that executes a directive
methods.detect_breaking_changes(old_schema, new_: Compare schemas and return list of breaking changes

constants.TokenType.NAME: GraphQL name token
constants.POSTGRES_MAPPINGS: Default type mappings for PostgreSQL database

terms.AST: Abstract Syntax Tree - hierarchical representation of parsed query
terms.N+1 problem: Performance issue where N additional queries are executed for N items
terms.impedance mismatch: Structural differences between GraphQL hierarchies and relational tables
terms.resolver: Function that fetches data for a GraphQL field
terms.DataLoader: Pattern for batching and caching data requests
terms.recursive descent: Parsing technique where each grammar rule corresponds to a function that may call itself
terms.token: Smallest meaningful unit of source code (keyword, identifier, punctuation)
terms.lexer: Component that breaks source string into tokens (also called tokenizer)
terms.lookahead: Examining upcoming tokens without consuming them
terms.syntax error: Error in query structure that violates GraphQL grammar rules
terms.escape sequence: Special character sequence starting with backslash (\n, \uXXXX)
terms.block string: Triple-quoted string with special whitespace handling
terms.inline fragment: ... on Type { selection } fragment without separate definition
terms.type condition: on Type part of fragment specifying applicable object type
terms.type system: The complete set of GraphQL type definitions and validation rules
terms.introspection: Querying database system catalogs to discover structure
terms.circular reference: When a table references itself or creates a reference cycle
terms.interface implementation: When an object type provides all fields defined in an interface
terms.type modifier: ListType or NonNullType wrapper that modifies another type's behavior
terms.input type: Types that can be used as arguments (scalars, enums, input objects)
terms.output type: Types that can be returned from fields (objects, interfaces, unions, scalars, enums)
terms.null propagation: GraphQL rule where errors in non-null fields cause parent fields to become null
terms.parallel execution: Executing independent sibling GraphQL fields concurrently
terms.schema reflection: Process of auto-generating GraphQL schemas from database metadata
terms.type mapping: Converting SQL data types to GraphQL scalar types
terms.relationship detection: Identifying foreign key constraints and translating them to GraphQL field relationships
terms.naming convention: Rules for transforming database names to GraphQL names
terms.cardinality: The numerical relationship between tables (one-to-one, one-to-many, etc.)
terms.system catalog: Database's internal tables describing its structure (information_schema, pg_catalog)
terms.foreign key constraint: Database constraint linking columns in one table to another table's primary key
terms.LATERAL JOIN: SQL join type that allows referencing columns from preceding tables in subqueries
terms.cartesian product: Result of joining tables without conditions, producing all combinations of rows
terms.parameter binding: Using placeholders in SQL statements and providing values separately to prevent injection
terms.result mapper: Function that transforms flat SQL result rows into nested GraphQL response structure
terms.join planning: Process of determining optimal order and type of SQL JOINs for a query
terms.partial results: GraphQL's model of returning data from successful fields alongside errors from failed fields
terms.error sanitization: Process of removing sensitive/internal details from error messages before exposing to users
terms.cursor pagination: Pagination method using opaque cursors instead of offsets for stable pagination across data changes
terms.diamond relationship: Query pattern where the same table is accessed via multiple paths in a single query
terms.polymorphic relationship: Interface/union type where different concrete types map to different database tables
terms.structured logging: Logging with consistent JSON format and contextual fields
terms.EXPLAIN plan: Database query execution plan showing optimization details
terms.request correlation: Connecting log entries across components using request ID
terms.AST visualization: Human-readable display of abstract syntax tree structure
terms.resolver tracing: Logging resolver function calls with arguments and timing
terms.SQL interception: Capturing SQL queries before execution for logging/analysis
terms.performance profiling: Measuring execution time of components to identify bottlenecks
terms.schema stitching: Combining multiple GraphQL schemas into a single unified schema
terms.subscriptions: Real-time data updates through persistent connections like WebSocket
terms.custom directives: Schema-level annotations that modify execution behavior
terms.query caching: Storing and reusing query results to improve performance
terms.extension point: Pluggable interface in the architecture that allows adding new functionality
terms.plugin system: Dynamic loading and management of extensions
terms.gateway pattern: Architecture where a central component routes requests to appropriate services
terms.pub/sub mechanism: Publish-subscribe pattern for broadcasting events to interested subscribers
terms.cache invalidation: Process of removing stale data from cache when underlying data changes
terms.directive execution hooks: Interception points where custom directive logic can run
terms.WebSocket transport: Bidirectional communication protocol for real-time data
terms.entrypoint loading: Dynamic discovery of plugins via Python package metadata
terms.dependency inversion: Design principle where high-level modules depend on abstractions, not concrete implementations
terms.zero-cost abstraction: Extension mechanism that adds no overhead when not used
terms.Open-Closed Principle: Software entities should be open for extension but closed for modification
